title: The Pragmatic Programmer: 20th Anniversary Edition, 2nd Edition: Your Journey to Mastery
author: Andrew Hunt, David Thomas
description: This updated edition of the classic book offers timeless advice and new insights for today's software developers. It covers a wide range of topics including software development principles, tools, and techniques.

title: Python Crash Course, 2nd Edition: A Hands-On, Project-Based Introduction to Programming
author: Eric Matthes
description: This updated edition of the popular book provides a practical and project-based introduction to Python programming. It covers basic programming concepts, Python syntax, and real-world projects to help readers quickly grasp Python development.

title: Cracking the Coding Interview: 189 Programming Questions and Solutions, 6th Edition
author: Gayle Laakmann McDowell
description: This bestselling book is a comprehensive guide to preparing for coding interviews at top tech companies. It includes 189 programming questions with detailed explanations and solutions, along with tips for tackling technical interviews.

title: Hands-On Machine Learning with Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow: Concepts, Tools, and Techniques to Build Intelligent Systems, 2nd Edition
author: Aurélien Géron
description: This updated edition of the bestselling book offers practical guidance on building machine learning systems using Scikit-Learn, Keras, and TensorFlow. It covers a wide range of topics including supervised and unsupervised learning, neural networks, and deep learning.

title: Deep Learning
author: Yoshua Bengio, Ian Goodfellow, Aaron Courville
description: This comprehensive textbook provides an in-depth introduction to deep learning. It covers fundamental concepts, advanced techniques, and practical applications of deep neural networks.

title: Hands-On Computer Vision with TensorFlow 2: Leverage deep learning to create powerful image processing apps with TensorFlow 2.0 and Keras
author: Eliot Andres
description: This practical guide teaches you how to build computer vision applications using TensorFlow 2.0 and Keras. It covers techniques such as image classification, object detection, and image segmentation, with hands-on examples and projects.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: A mesmerizing novel about regret, hope, and second chances, where a library between life and death offers patrons the opportunity to explore the lives they could have lived.

title: Where the Crawdads Sing
author: Delia Owens
description: A gripping mystery and coming-of-age tale set in the marshlands of North Carolina, where the isolated 'Marsh Girl' becomes the prime suspect in a murder investigation.

title: The Four Winds
author: Kristin Hannah
description: Set during the Great Depression, this powerful novel follows a woman's journey as she leaves her drought-stricken farm in Texas in search of a better life for her family in California.

title: Klara and the Sun
author: Kazuo Ishiguro
description: In a dystopian future, Klara, an artificial friend, observes the complexities of human behavior and longs to be chosen by a child as her companion.

title: A Promised Land
author: Barack Obama
description: The highly anticipated memoir of Barack Obama, the 44th President of the United States, covering his early political career, presidential campaign, and first term in office.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychological thriller revolving around a woman who shoots her husband and then stops speaking, and the psychotherapist determined to uncover the truth behind her silence.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: Michelle Obama's candid and inspiring memoir, chronicling her journey from her childhood in Chicago to her years as First Lady of the United States.

title: Anxious People
author: Fredrik Backman
description: A humorous and heartwarming novel that explores the quirks of human nature, following a failed bank robbery turned hostage situation and the unlikely connections formed among the hostages.

title: Where the Forest Meets the Stars
author: Glendy Vanderah
description: A touching story about loss, healing, and the power of love, as a woman's solitary life in a remote cabin is disrupted by the arrival of a mysterious child with a secret.

title: The Vanishing Half
author: Brit Bennett
description: A novel exploring themes of identity, race, and family, as twin sisters lead vastly different lives, one passing as white while the other embraces her black heritage.

title: Such a Fun Age
author: Kiley Reid
description: A thought-provoking novel about race, privilege, and social dynamics, as a young black woman working as a babysitter becomes entangled in her employer's personal and professional life.

title: The Guest List
author: Lucy Foley
description: A thrilling and atmospheric mystery set on a remote island off the coast of Ireland, where a glamorous wedding celebration turns deadly.

title: Educated
author: Tara Westover
description: The memoir of Tara Westover, who grew up in a strict and isolated household in rural Idaho and went on to pursue education against all odds, eventually earning a PhD from Cambridge University.

title: The Water Dancer
author: Ta-Nehisi Coates
description: A powerful novel exploring the legacy of slavery and the fight for freedom, as a young man with a mysterious power embarks on a journey to rescue his enslaved family.

title: Normal People
author: Sally Rooney
description: An intimate and emotionally resonant novel about the complex relationship between two young people from different backgrounds as they navigate love, friendship, and adulthood.

title: The Dutch House
author: Ann Patchett
description: A compelling family saga spanning five decades, revolving around the lives of siblings and their connection to the opulent estate known as the Dutch House.

title: The Nickel Boys
author: Colson Whitehead
description: Inspired by true events, this novel follows the experiences of two boys at a reform school in Jim Crow-era Florida, shedding light on systemic injustice and resilience in the face of adversity.

title: Circe
author: Madeline Miller
description: A spellbinding retelling of the myth of Circe, the enchantress from Homer's Odyssey, as she discovers her own powers and navigates the complexities of immortality, love, and identity.

title: The Testaments
author: Margaret Atwood
description: A sequel to Margaret Atwood's dystopian masterpiece, The Handmaid's Tale, providing insight into the inner workings of the oppressive regime of Gilead through the perspectives of three different women.

title: Little Fires Everywhere
author: Celeste Ng
description: A compelling novel about motherhood, privilege, and the complexities of human relationships, as the lives of two families in suburban Ohio become intertwined and secrets come to light.
